content.description: Sit start on a good left hand crimp and a decent right hand pinch under a steep section of the boulder. Throw left hand to a good edge and continue up the sharp crimps to top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, the landing beneath the easier moves below the top out slopes downward and isn't ideal.
content.location: Located on the boulder slightly downhill and to the left of Acid Drop (from the approach), the climb faces the downhill side of the boulder.  The bolt and hanger halfway up the face is another unique feature of this boulder problem.

content.description: Step up onto the shelf make a reach move to a deep crimp then follow the holds up and slightly left for a heady mantle
content.location: To the left of the warm up Boulder obvious slab/face still covered in lichen

content.description: A classic of the South Mountain area, sit down start on the sloping rail and a high right foot.  Move up to an incut right hand side pull and match on the sloping rail with the left hand.  Cross over and grab the small flat edge and dyno to a jug at 3/4 height of the face.  Utilizing the flake and some big reaches top out the boulder.
content.location: The slightly overhanging face downhill about 30 yards from the where the rocks first appear.

content.description: It would not be a classic atown area with out the spray paint that is always changing. Look through the paint to find some of the best classic routes in the area.
